title: Olympia Visibility Brigade
description: Join us weekly for visibility and protest efforts on overpasses in the Olympia-Tumwater-Lacey area. Bring protest signs, flags, and enjoy inclusivity.
raw_text:
Impatient for the next big protest? Us too! Join us weekly to make good trouble!

OLYMPIA VISIBILITY BRIGADE

We deploy each weekend on overpasses in the Olympia-Tumwater-Lacey area
We also deploy on Mondays during evening rush hour
We support Capitol protests when possible

Bring your high-viz protest signs, flags, fun costumes,
a good mood, and be tolerant of terrible dancing.
Introverts welcome!

Upcoming Event:
Monday, June 23rd @ 4:30 - 6:30 pm
Boulevard Rd SE over I-5, East Olympia

Look for upcoming Olympia Visibility Brigade 
events at theblop.org and 
backbonecampaign.org

An upcoming event is scheduled for Monday, June 23rd, from 4:30 to 6:30 pm at Boulevard Rd SE over I-5, East Olympia. The flyer invites participants to bring protest signs and emphasizes inclusivity.

title: Rally & Candlelight Vigil for Palestine
description: Join us in a rally and candlelight vigil for Palestine. The event will start with activities encouraging participants to bring signs, flags, instruments, and noisemakers, followed by a vigil providing candles and opportunities to read poems or statements. Donations are accepted for PCRF and healpalestine.org.
raw_text:
genocide
geno¬∑cide /' jen…ô,sid/
noun.
The deliberate killing of a large number of people from a particular nation or ethnic group with the aim of destroying that nation or group.

RALLY & CANDLELIGHT VIGIL FOR PALESTINE
TUES, JUNE 24
7-9 PM
MEDINA SQUARE

RALLY (7-8 PM)
BRING A SIGN
BRING A FLAG
BRING AN INSTRUMENT
BRING A NOISEMAKER

VIGIL (8-9 PM)
CANDLES PROVIDED
BRING A POEM TO READ
BRING A STATEMENT

ACCEPTING DONATIONS TO PCRF & healpalestine.org

Since October 6, 2023, over 55,000 Palestinians have been killed. 17,400 children were killed. 66,000 children are severely malnourished. The UN stated Gaza is at risk of famine due to deliberate blockades of food continue.
raw_summary: The image advertises a "Rally & Candlelight Vigil for Palestine" taking place on Tuesday, June 24, from 7-9 PM at Medina Square. It includes a rally from 7-8 PM, encouraging participants to bring signs, flags, instruments, and noisemakers. The vigil from 8-9 PM provides candles and invites participants to read poems or statements. Donations to PCRF and healpalestine.org are mentioned. There is also information highlighting the plight of Palestinians.

title: Protest Festival
description: Join us for the Protest Festival at All Souls Church to celebrate Pride Month. You'll have the opportunity to engage with music, speeches, games, and learn how to advocate for your community. This event is about expressing joy, community connection, and fighting for everyone's rights.
raw_text: DSA SHREVEPORT, IN COLLABORATION WITH A NUMBER OF LOCAL GROUPS, PRESENTS: PROTEST FESTIVAL PRIDE IN DUE PROCESS: RIGHTS FOR Y'ALL MEANS RIGHTS FOR ALL! @ ALL SOULS CHURCH ON JUNE 28TH FROM 12PM TO 5PM SPEECHES, MUSIC, GAMES, AND MORE! COME CELEBRATE PRIDE MONTH WITH US WHILE ALSO LEARNING HOW YOU CAN FIGHT FOR YOUR COMMUNITY! COME PROTEST BY EXPRESSING JOY AND CONNECTING WITH YOUR COMMUNITY. WE WON'T LET THEM SCARE US! WE NEED TO FIGHT FOR OUR RIGHTS, WHICH MEANS WE MUST FIGHT FOR EVERYONE‚ÄôS RIGHTS!
raw_summary: The image is an event flyer for a 'Protest Festival' hosted by DSA Shreveport, in collaboration with local groups, taking place at All Souls Church on June 28th from 12 PM to 5 PM. The event celebrates Pride Month with activities like speeches, music, games, and learning opportunities for fighting for community rights. The emphasis is on expressing joy and community connection.

title: No Kings 2.0
description: This event aims to reclaim America's promise of freedom and justice for all while opposing authoritarianism and corrupt leadership. It's a nationwide movement inviting everyone who believes in true liberty.
raw_text:
NO KINGS 2.0
NATIONAL PROTEST - JULY 4TH, 2025

INDEPENDENCE WITHOUT TYRANNY

This 4th of July, we're reclaiming America's promise: Freedom for all. Justice for all. NO KINGS.

What started as a local protest is now a nationwide movement. This isn‚Äôt about left vs. right - this is about the people vs, power unchecked. No more leaders above the law. No more silence when rights are stripped away, No more fear, manipulation, or false patriotism.

JOIN US ON JULY 4TH
From coast to coast, city streets to small towns - we‚Äôre raising our vos:

Against authoritarianism
Against corrupt leadership
Against racism, xenophobia, and injustice.
For the rights of immigrants, workers, families, and everyday Americans
For truth, transparency, and equality under the Constitution

WHEN: All day, July 4, 2025
WHERE: Your city, your streets.

WHO‚ÄôS INVITED?
Everyone who believes in liberty ‚Äî true liberty, not just the brand sold during election season. This is for the silenced. The forgotten. The rising generation. This is for YOU.

WE ARE NOT BACKING DOWN.
We are not celebrating freedom while people are still in cages.
We are not pledging allegiance to leaders who want to rule ‚Äî not serve. We are not staying quiet when justice is on the line.
raw_summary: The image announces a national protest happening on July 4th, 2025, called "No Kings 2.0", advocating for freedom and justice, and opposing authoritarianism and corrupt leadership. It's a nationwide event inviting everyone who believes in true liberty.

title: Celebration of Science, Learning, and Libraries
description: Join us to advocate against the elimination of critical funding to libraries, cuts to science grants, and attacks on education. Gather at Sylvester Park and march to the Capitol Building for speeches.
address: Legislative Building - North Steps, Sylvester Park
raw_text:
Flame the Enlightenment

CELEBRATION OF SCIENCE, LEARNING, AND LIBRARIES

Legislative Building - North Steps, Sylvester Park, Olympia, WA

July 12, 2025

11AM-3PM

Carl Sagan, the science popularizer wrote in the book, "Demon-Haunted World: Science as a Candle in the Dark," that attacks on science, education and libraries brought about the Dark Ages. Meet at Sylvester Park, then march to the North Steps of the Capital Building for speakers. Protest the elimination of critical funding to the Institute of Library Sciences (IMLS), cuts to critical science grants, and the attacks on higher education, and public instruction. Please contact Wendy at 360-349-2158 or wendy.tassoni@gmail.com.
raw_summary: The image is an event flyer for "Celebration of Science, Learning, and Libraries," scheduled for July 12, 2025, from 11 AM to 3 PM. It will take place at the Legislative Building - North Steps, Sylvester Park, Olympia, WA. The event is about advocating against attacks on science and education. It includes a march and talks to protest against funding cuts to libraries and education sectors.
